http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv-community.gif http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT List EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT List Archives https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT&v=ATOM1.0
This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-12T14:03:26Z Newell Hampson-Jones 2015-03-12T14:03:13+00:00 2015-03-12T14:03:13+00:00 Internships at BSI https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;527c7436.1503 Hi all,<br><br>BSI has 3 internships available for students, that are paid at London Living Wage (\ufffd\ufffd9.15 per hour).<br><br>The advert and application link is below.<br><br>https://globalcareers-bsigroup.icims.com/jobs/1708/standards-policy-intern---3-month-internship/job<br><br>Many thanks,<br><br>Newell Hampson-Jones<br>Strategic Engagement Manager, Education<br><br>T: +44 (0)20 8996 7227 | M: +44 (0) 7939 821833<br>newell.hampson-jones@bsigroup.com<mailto:newell.hampson-jones@bsigroup.com> |@thenhj<https://twitter.com/thenhj> |tumblr<http://thenhj.tumblr.com/> |blog<http://thenhjumblr.tumblr.com/> |LinkedIn<https://www.linkedin.com/in/nhampsonjones><br><br>[cid:image005.jpg@01D05CCD.46432140]<br>BSI Group, 389 Chiswick High Road, London, W4 4AL, UK<br>bsigroup.com<http://www.bsigroup.com/> | Twitter<https://twitter.com/BSI_UK> | LinkedIn<https://www.linkedin.com/company/bsi> [...] Standage, Helen 2015-03-11T13:40:19+00:00 2015-03-11T13:40:19+00:00 Research on Embedding Employability Teaching into Degree Subject https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;38b490f6.1503 Dear All,<br><br>A quick query, does anyone know of any research reporting benefits (or not) of embedding employability teaching into the degree subject? Thank you.<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Helen<br><br>Dr Helen Standage<br>Employability Tutor<br>Employability and Careers Centre (Square 2, Room 4.402)<br>University of Essex, Wivenhoe Park, Colchester, CO4 3SQ, UK<br>T: 01206 873166 | E: hjstan@essex.ac.uk<br><br>Website: essex.ac.uk/careers<http://www.essex.ac.uk/careers><br>Essex CareerHub: essex.ac.uk/see/careerhub<https://careerhub.essex.ac.uk/><br>Twitter: @UoE_Careers<http://twitter.com/UoE_Careers><br>Facebook: /EmployabilityandCareersEssex<http://www.facebook.com/EmployabilityandCareersEssex><br>Find us with FindYourWay@Essex<http://findyourway.essex.ac.uk/RL3/UEssexC.php?search=Employability%20and%20Careers%20Centre&slid=6380> [...] Nicholas Bowskill 2015-03-11T09:49:12+00:00 2015-03-11T09:49:12+00:00 'Student-Generated Induction: A Social Identity Approach,' York March 25th https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;2ff7391c.1503 *"We implemented your student generated model of induction at our September<br>2014 inductions and our generic feedback scores rose from around 3.2/5 to<br>4.6/5. Pretty impressive!!!\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd* [Principal Fellow of the HEA]<br><br>Hi Everyone,<br>Just to let you know that there are some places still available for this<br>workshop.<br><br>Challenging conventional tutor-led approaches to student retention, this<br>social and participative approach to induction may be of interest to people<br>on this list. The practice is based on a peer-to-peer relationship and<br>provides a strong fit with modern concepts such as 'Student-As-Producer'<br>and 'Student-As-Partner.' [...] Rajesh Dhimar 2015-03-10T09:14:18+00:00 2015-03-10T09:14:18+00:00 Higher Education Academy Professional Recognition writing retreats - Senior and Principal Fellowship https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;e55805be.1503 Are you interested in achieving Senior or Principal Fellowship of the Higher Education Academy? If so our writing retreats may be of interest to you.<br><br>We have two dates available depending on which category of Fellowship you are aiming for.<br><br>* Senior Fellow writing retreat, 27 May 2015, The University of Edinburgh - https://www.heacademy.ac.uk/events-conferences/event10198<br>* Principal Fellow writing retreat, 8 April 2015, Sheffield Hallam University - https://www.heacademy.ac.uk/events-conferences/event10197 [...] Sharon Heleine 2015-03-09T16:23:51+00:00 2015-03-09T16:23:51+00:00 How to measure impact of employability activities? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;ba6c548a.1503 Hi Colleagues<br><br>Greetings from chilly Leeds. We are currently investigating strategies for measuring the success of employability (and enterprise) activities, both in qualitative and quantitative terms.<br>I would be grateful if you have any thoughts you could share about how you measure similar activities.<br><br>I look forward to hearing from you,<br><br>Kind regards<br><br>Sharon Heleine<br>Assistant Manager<br>Partnerships and Professional Engagement<br>Sharon.heleine@leeds-art.ac.uk<mailto:Sharon.heleine@leeds-art.ac.uk><br>[http://www.leeds-art.ac.uk/emaillogo.png] [...] Pat Cullum 2015-03-06T16:15:04+00:00 2015-03-06T16:15:04+00:00 Re: PhD resources for skills https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;a79063df.1503 Hi,<br>Have you looked at the resources here http://jobsontoast.com/ They are aimed at PhDs transitioning out of academia, which will be some of the students you are working with, but I think there will be some things for those planning to stay too.<br><br>Dr Pat Cullum BA (Hons) DPhil FRHistS, FHEA<br>School Co-ordinator for Student Experience<br>School of Music, Humanities and Media<br>University of Huddersfield<br>HUDDERSFIELD HD1 3DH<br>West Yorkshire UK<br>Tel: + 44 (0)1484 472315<br>Fax: + 44 (0) 1484 472655<br>Email: p.c.cullum@hud.ac.uk<br>www.hud.ac.uk/mhm/history/ [...] Milner, Sharon 2015-03-06T15:50:56+00:00 2015-03-06T15:50:56+00:00 PhD resources for skills https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;fe4b7dcf.1503 Dear all<br>I am going to be running a session with phd students next week on strategic career management. In the past I have carried out a skills sort exercise based on a research project carried out re. Phd and employer views on skills PhDs have to offer. However the research is now a bit dated.<br>Would anyone have any ideas/ resources that they be willing to share for a group exercise looking at this area? I will of course share any resources to anyone who is interested.<br>Best wishes<br>Sharon Rajesh Dhimar 2015-03-06T13:22:31+00:00 2015-03-06T13:22:31+00:00 Higher Education Academy Professional Recognition writing retreats - Senior and Principal Fellowship https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;e78d3714.1503 Are you interested in achieving Senior or Principal Fellowship of the Higher Education Academy? If so our writing retreats may be of interest to you.<br><br>We have two dates available depending on which category of Fellowship you are aiming for.<br><br>* Senior Fellow writing retreat, 27 May 2015, The University of Edinburgh - https://www.heacademy.ac.uk/events-conferences/event10198 [...] Nicholas Bowskill 2015-03-05T16:22:27+00:00 2015-03-05T16:22:27+00:00 Re: Employability at Induction- data collection & promoting engagement https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;55384b3e.1503 Hi Hayley,<br>Our 'Student-Generated Induction' process is perfect for that. It is based<br>on what the students are actually thinking rather than what we think they<br>ought to know on arrival. Its also been used to measure the collective<br>journey over time from one year to another. We've run it going from<br>induction to transition and you can see the patterns and how they change<br>over time. That helps you adapt your support to remain socially contingent. [...] Hayley Wright 2015-03-05T15:48:08+00:00 2015-03-05T15:48:08+00:00 Employability at Induction- data collection & promoting engagement https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;4be8d2c6.1503 Hi everyone,<br><br>Here at MMU I have been tasked with exploring how we can improve the way we promote employability at induction stage.<br>Our aim is to be able to gather information from each student at the start of each year (do they have any career ideas yet, have they gained any experience, what areas would they like more confidence in etc) and use the information to influence the support we offer throughout the year. Longer term we can use the info to track student development and spot patterns across courses.<br>We also hope that we can use the time [...] Helena Pimlott-Wilson 2015-03-05T09:40:04+00:00 2015-03-05T09:40:04+00:00 Re: Placement Assessment on Business UG degrees https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;3e626e1c.1503 Hi,<br><br>Ours in Geography used a combination of others already mentioned:<br><br>- two formal appraisals by the company<br>- short reflective diary entries<br>- a presentation upon return to University (Part A & B students invited to learn about a peers\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd experiences)<br>- an essay of up to 5000 words linking geographical theories to a placement work-related topic (or topics) [...] Nortcliffe, Anne 2015-03-04T17:13:27+00:00 2015-03-04T17:13:27+00:00 Re: Placement Assessment on Business UG degrees https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;5ad7fc58.1503 Hi,<br><br>From Sunny and windy SHU.<br><br>In Eng', Maths and comp' the placement is non credit bearing. Though for admin' purpose the student transcript shows 1 credit if they pass, as the placement is pass/fail and has an exam board. The Assessment is:<br>* 2-3 performance reviews,<br>* min' 9 monthly reviews,<br>* a placement plan,<br>* a presentation to the employer and * academic of their reflections of the placement and the placement learning<br>* two placement visits reviews<br>* a poster presented at Learning Employment Fair to level 4, and 5 student. [...] Nortcliffe, Anne 2015-03-04T17:07:48+00:00 2015-03-04T17:07:48+00:00 Re: Placement Assessment on Business UG degrees https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;b9701df2.1503 Hi,<br><br>From Sunny and windy SHU.<br><br>In Eng', Maths and comp' the placement is non credit bearing. Though for admin' purpose the student transcript shows 1 credit if they pass, as the placement is pass/fail and has an exam board. The Assessment is:<br>* 2-3 performance reviews,<br>* min' 9 monthly reviews,<br>* a placement plan,<br>* a presentation to the employer and * academic of their reflections of the placement and the placement learning<br>* two placement visits reviews<br>* a poster presented at Learning Employment Fair to level 4, and 5 student. [...] Joanne Dickinson 2015-03-04T16:04:37+00:00 2015-03-04T16:04:37+00:00 Re: Placement Assessment on Business UG degrees https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;345889d6.1503 Good afternoon<br>At Leeds University Business School our model is also similar to that of Northumbria<br>So Placement year is currently non-credit bearing - pass/fail<br>If they pass they get year in industry after their degree \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd but all progress to final year<br>Students produce a skills-based portfolio comprised of reflective entries and supporting evidence built up throughout the placement<br>They also submit an updated skills based CV so that they are ready to apply for graduate positions if they haven\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt secured a graduate role \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdvia the placement\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>We felt it would be difficult to assign credits \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd as students [...] Phil Brown 2015-03-04T15:21:43+00:00 2015-03-04T15:21:43+00:00 Re: Placement Assessment on Business UG degrees https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;b76e8e21.1503 Hi All<br><br>For our sports programmes we have a year-long 20 credit placement module (Placement Learning: Integrating Theory with Practice) in our second year. Placement is 100 hours. Assessment is via a reflective essay and portfolio.<br><br>If anyone is interested in more detail please contact me directly.<br><br>Best wishes Phil<br><br>Phil Brown<br>Senior Lecturer<br>Programme Leader: Sport Development Framework<br>Email pbrown@marjon.ac.uk<mailto:pbrown@marjon.ac.uk><br>Telephone 01752 636700 Ext: 8691 [...] Judith Taylor 2015-03-04T15:15:12+00:00 2015-03-04T15:15:12+00:00 Re: Placement Assessment on Business UG degrees https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;8ae0caad.1503 Good afternoon all<br><br>NCFE, a national Awarding Organisation, has a Level 2 Certificate in Employability Skills, which aims to develop and enhance skills required for the working environment and improve learners' confidence and communication skills in order to prepare them for employment or for a change in employment.<br><br>Although it would not assess the specific degree discipline, it provides a structured approach to recording learning outcomes achieved, by the production of a portfolio of evidence. The details are in the link below but do contact me if you think this might be useful for your students? [...] Clifford, Elizabeth 2015-03-04T14:52:07+00:00 2015-03-04T14:52:07+00:00 Re: Placement Assessment on Business UG degrees https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;ba947e18.1503 This is similar to what happens on sandwich placements here at LJMU. It would be interesting to know what others do in relation to credit and assessments. We are currently considering allocating credit to placements.<br><br>Best wishes<br>Liz<br><br>Teaching and Learning Academy<br>Liverpool John Moores University<br><br>From: List for UK HEI employability developers [mailto:EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Ruth Lawton<br>Sent: 04 March 2015 13:39<br>To: EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Placement Assessment on Business UG degrees [...] Ruth Lawton 2015-03-04T13:38:56+00:00 2015-03-04T13:38:56+00:00 Re: Placement Assessment on Business UG degrees https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;e6375a06.1503 That is almost exactly what I suggested as an assessment brief - haha, I am chuffed with myself here in windy Brum:)<br><br>From: List for UK HEI employability developers [mailto:EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Christine Sorensen<br>Sent: 04 March 2015 13:11<br>To: EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Placement Assessment on Business UG degrees<br><br>Actually it would be good to share this rather than email Vicky - if that's OK? [...] Christine Sorensen 2015-03-04T13:10:38+00:00 2015-03-04T13:10:38+00:00 Re: Placement Assessment on Business UG degrees https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;903fa166.1503 Actually it would be good to share this rather than email Vicky - if that's OK?<br><br>At Northumbria our Placement year is non-credit bearing - is that true for others? Only pass/fail but even then this does not exclude them from progressing to their final year, merely means that their transcript does not include the word Placement [...] Henshall, Lisa 2015-03-04T10:52:01+00:00 2015-03-04T10:52:01+00:00 Placement Assessment on Business UG degrees https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;9bdb6af7.1503 Good morning from a very sunny Essex!<br><br>Thank you so much for the responses to my last email message on general CDL and assessment - it was much appreciated and very useful! We have another query which we seek thoughts and feedback on below!<br><br>We are in the process of reviewing how we assess the placement year of our Business School undergraduate degrees.<br>Currently we ask students to produce 3 pieces of written coursework (totalling 10,000 words) during their placement. Feedback from students suggests this is "assessment heavy". [...] Nicholas Bowskill 2015-03-03T15:23:46+00:00 2015-03-03T15:23:46+00:00 'Student-Generated Induction: A Social Identity Approach,' York March 25th https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;dd4e9ad6.1503 Apologies. Updated version below<br><br>" A new way of addressing induction with an informed and researched<br>pedagogy to underpin the discussion" [Workshop Participant]<br><br>Dear All,<br>Challenging conventional tutor-led approaches to student retention, this<br>social and participative approach to induction may be of interest to people<br>on this list. This practice is based on a peer-to-peer relationship and<br>provides a strong fit with contemporary concepts such as 'Student-As-Producer'<br>and 'Student-As-Partner.' [...] Rob Ward 2015-03-03T09:58:32+00:00 2015-03-03T09:58:32+00:00 FORTHCOMING WEBINAR- Integrating the HEAR with an extra-curricular Award, Thursday 5th March 2015, https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;57ca0884.1503 Integrating the HEAR with the Leicester Award<br>Led By Elizabeth Cornish, University of Leicester<br>Thursday 5th March 2015, 12.30p.m. \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 13.30p.m.<br><br>Hi everyone<br><br>This lunch-time webinar will look at the University of Leicester\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds ongoing journey towards implementing the HEAR, focusing on how the Career Development Service have integrated the HEAR with the Leicester Award and used it to encourage students\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd engagement in extra curricular activity. We have just a few places available, so if this is of interest to you please complete the online booking form here<http://www.recordingachievement.org/news-and-events/events/icalrepeat.detail/2015/03/05/750/48%7C49%7C70/OGE4YmMyZmUwMjcyMWNlODU4OTBiZjI3YzM2YTdmMmM=.html>. This is free to CRA members, there is a small charge for others. [...] Milner, Sharon 2015-03-02T11:01:33+00:00 2015-03-02T11:01:33+00:00 Invitation to Ulster University 'Employability In Action' Conference 6th May 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=EMPLOYABILITY-DEVELOPMENT;4cafbbf5.1503 [Ulster University - Logo]<br><br>[Ulster University Students]<http://employability.ulster.ac.uk/2015conf/index.html><br><br>Conference Invitation<br><br>Employability in Action: Opportunities for Developing the Student Experience<br><br>Date: Wednesday 6th May 2015, 10am - 2pm<br><br>Venue: Jordanstown Campus, Ulster University<br><br>Ulster University announces its sixth conference to foster the exchange of best practice in employability.<br><br>This conference will address the question of how Higher Education can respond to challenges and opportunities in implementing and supporting the student experience. It will focus on challenges in relation to developing a curriculum that enhances graduate attributes, exploring links between research-teaching and employability. It will explore opportunities and strategic partnerships that HE institutions [...]
